intro: Simarouba amara, commonly known as the bitter wood or amara tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and alternate, simple leaves with a leathery texture. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are followed by woody fruits containing several seeds. The tree is valued for its hard, heavy wood and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
